void Mesh::calculateNormals (  ) 

This function will rewrite ALL normal vectors, causing total loss of normal data To reobtain normal data, simply reload the .obj file

Definition at line 302 of file mesh.cpp.

00302                             {
00303     //First, clear normal data
00304     normals.resize(vertices.size());
00305     for (int i = 0; i < normals.size(); i++) {
00306         normals[i] = Point3(0,0,0);
00307     }
00308 
00309     //This will add every face's normal to all of the vertices of that face
00310     //then reassign each normal index to the corresponding vertex index
00311     for (int i = 0; i < faces.size(); i++) {
00312         faces[i].addOwnNormals();
00313     }
00314 
00315     //This will normalize all normals, so that they are unit
00316     for (int i = 0; i < normals.size(); i++) {
00317         normals[i] = normals[i].getUnit();
00318     }
00319 }

00322     Point3 center(0,0,0);
00323     for (int i = 0; i < vertices.size(); i++) {
00324         center = center + vertices[i]/((double)vertices.size());

double Mesh::calculateAverageRadius (  ) 

Definition at line 329 of file mesh.cpp.

00329                                     {
00330     Point3 center = calculateCenter();
00331     double average = 0;
00332     for (int i = 0; i < vertices.size(); i++) {
00333         average = average + (vertices[i] - center).getMag()/((double)vertices.size());
00334     }
00335     return average;
00336 }
